sentence.Network_en: Most of the children were noisy and boisterous.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数孩子都又吵又闹。

sentence.Network_en: It was a challenge, keeping ten boisterous seven-year-olds amused.
sentence.Network_cn: 要逗着十个好动的七岁孩子玩真是一种挑战。

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... bogus adj． 假装的，假的 boisterous adj． 喧闹的，欢闹的 bolster n． 枕垫v．支持，鼓励.
AMG 音乐情绪词典 ... Bleak 阴郁的 Boisterous 狂暴的 Brash 无礼的.
字典中闹字的解释 ... 闹、閙 nào (4) 热闹[ boisterous;lively;have a joy time] (1) 争吵[ make a noise;stir up trouble].
新东方GRE词汇 - 豆丁网 ... boggle v. 因为怀疑，恐惧而犹豫 boisterous adj. 吵闹的 bolster ? v. 支持.

list.abs: his former owner decided they couldn't cope with such a boisterous animal .他的前老板决定他们无法应付这样一个热闹的动物。
We can hear their boisterous laughter in the next room ., 我们可以听到他们在隔壁房间的喧闹的笑声.
To laugh or joke , especially boisterously ., 大笑大笑或开玩笑 , 尤指吵闹地.
n.建议boisterous activities 吵闹的活动wasteland

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'rough, stiff'): variant of earlier boistuous 'rustic, coarse, boisterous', of unknown origin

entry.tran: 喧闹的；活泼的；精力充沛的
entry.def: Someone who is boisterous is noisy, lively, and full of energy.

example.tran: 一群大声喧嚷但很和善的人

example.ex: Most of the children were noisy and boisterous.
example.tran: 大多数孩子都又吵又闹。

means.word_mean: 1. noisy and lacking in restraint or discipline;

sentences.sentence: "a social gathering that became rambunctious and out of hand"
"beneath the rumbustious surface of his paintings is sympathy for the vulnerability of ordinary human beings"

means.word_mean: 2. full of rough and exuberant animal spirits;

sentences.sentence: "the fierce thunders roar me their music"- Ezra Pound

means.word_mean: 热闹的；喧闹的;爱闹的;狂欢的

sentences.en: As midnight drew on,the party became more boisterous.
sentences.cn: 随着午夜的临近,参加宴会的人变得更加喧闹。

sentences.en: A boisterous horse must have a rough bridle.
